page.title: 19POLITICS IN PURTON STOKE
page.content: In Purton Stoke 2 Parish Councillors were needed.So an election was held on the 4th July 1985. Richard John Scott swept to victory by receiving 153 votes, but the Liberal candidate Alan Ronald Timpson only received 66 votes. The remaining candidates consisted of James Sebastian Caslaw with 60 votes; John Stuart Rainbow,36 votes; and Terrence Robert Giles,22 votes. The by_elections were called suddenly due to the shock death of Councillor David Evans and also the resignation of Councillor Dorothy Dunn . The next meeting of the Parish Council was August 5. A bill posted on a telegraph pole by the post office and an article in the Wootton Bassett Standard,Friday July 12,gave us this information.
